bug.author: Hadi-H
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h4>Issue Description</denchmark-h>
I get "Segmentation fault (core dumped)" error when I try to use MultiDataSetIterator in a ComputationGraph having 2 output classifier. Here is a link to the code: <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/Hadi-H/443a21f21204b5e6a88b9869a45994f3>https://gist.github.com/Hadi-H/443a21f21204b5e6a88b9869a45994f3</denchmark-link>
This is my pom file: <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/Hadi-H/5d96a5309acf7e52d812fdcde9b69b71>https://gist.github.com/Hadi-H/5d96a5309acf7e52d812fdcde9b69b71</denchmark-link>
OS: Ubuntu Server 16.04 LTS Config: 16 vcpus, 64 GB memory This is the error, which I get: <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/Hadi-H/bd14f194c0785bdd0c07a54c01877563>https://gist.github.com/Hadi-H/bd14f194c0785bdd0c07a54c01877563</denchmark-link>
Here is a link to the /home/hadi/jarFiles/hs_err_pid46365.log: <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/Hadi-H/ece4910059a400e619c823334fc26bbd>https://gist.github.com/Hadi-H/ece4910059a400e619c823334fc26bbd</denchmark-link>
Any help is very appreciated.

comments.comment: Which version of DL4J are you using?
Thanks for the prompt reply. The dl4j version is 0.9.1. I've also attached my pom file
can you please add /home/hadi/jarFiles/hs_err_pid46365.log to the issue?
Closing as outdated - we haven't had reports of this since, and there has been a ton of workspace-related fixes since 0.9.1 (which is by far the most likely candidate for these sorts of crashes).
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
